text: John Leoline Phillips (2 August 1879 – 31 March 1947) Deaths The Times (London, England), Wednesday, 2 April 1947; pg. 1; Issue 50725 was the Dean of Monmouth from 1931Ecclesiastical News The Times (London, England), Wednesday, 4 February 1931; pg. 14; Issue 45738 until 1946.Ecclesiastical News The Times (London, England), Thursday, 29 August 1946; pg. 6; Issue 50542 Phillips was born in Radyr. He was educated at Christ College, Brecon, and Keble College, Oxford;PHILLIPS, Very Rev. John Leoline’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2015; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 23 March 2015 and ordained in 1909."Crockford's Clerical Directory, 1929 p1017 London, OUP, 1929 He was a schoolmaster at St Paul's West Kensington from 1905 until 1921Getty Images (also serving in the RAOC during World War One) when he became Headmaster of his old school, a post he held until his appointment as Dean. He died in Newport. ==References== Category:1879 births Category:People from Cardiff Category:People educated at Christ College, Brecon Category:Alumni of Keble College, Oxford Category:Royal Army Ordnance Corps officers Category:Welsh Anglicans Category:Deans of Monmouth Category:1947 deaths
title: John Phillips (priest)
